Pieces move diagonally to empty adjacent points. | designer = | illustrator = | publisher = | players = 2 | ages = | setup_time = 1 minute | playing_time = 10 minutes | random_chance = None | skills = [[Strategy]] | bggid = 25471 }} '''Five Field Kono''' is a [[Korea]]n [[abstract strategy game]]. As in [[Chinese checkers]], a player wins by moving all of their pieces into the starting locations of their opponent's pieces. ==Rules== The players take turns moving one of their pieces one square diagonally. The first player to move all of their pieces to their opponent's starting squares wins. ==Bibliography== *{{cite book |last=Bell |first=R. C. |title=Board and Table Games from Many Civilizations, volume 1 |year=1979 |publisher=[[Dover Publications]] |location=[[New York City]] |isbn=0-486-23855-5<!-- Volumes 1 and 2 are bound in the same book and thus have the same ISBN. --> |pages=98 }} *{{cite book |last=Culin |first=Stewart |authorlink=Stewart Culin |title=[[Korean Games]] |year=1895 |location=[[Philadelphia]] |pages=102 }} ==External links== *[http://www.darkfish.com/kono/FiveFieldKono.html Five Field Kono applet] *[http://www.zillions-of-games.com/cgi-bin/zilligames/submissions.cgi/94592?do=show;id=412 Five Field Kono] at [[Zillions of Games]] [[Category:Abstract strategy games]] [[Category:Traditional board games]] [[Category:Korean games]]
